cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 1505 miles east of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move west-northwest for the next two days, then gradually curve northwest and north well east of the Leeward Islands toward the open Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None (not forecast to make landfall during the 5-day period)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and adjacent Atlantic waters north of 15–20°N, 55–60°W
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Sunday; brief gusty squalls possible if the track shifts closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected with current forecast track (storm passes far northeast of Puerto Rico).
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring isolated showers late weekend, but significant accumulations are unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period northerly swells generated by Jose may reach north-facing harbor entrances late weekend, causing rough seas and potentially affecting pilot transfers and cargo operations.
